alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Ohio; Ripley; Switzerland (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 3:50AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, RIPLEY, DEARBORN AND NORTHWESTERN SWITZERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 430 AM EST... At 349 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located over North Vernon, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Rising Sun, Bright, Hidden Valley, Versailles, Milan, Osgood, Dillsboro, Moores Hill, Guilford, Wilmington, Logan, Manchester, French, Sunman, Hartford and St. Leon. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 149 and 171. I-74 in Ohio near mile marker 0. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
